history.text: !ereht iH
Hello, have you ever watched the movie Home Alone directed by Chris Columbus? It has an A rating on CinemaSCore!
Omg that was backwards lol. I have not read that.
I mean watched that lol
You should watch it! I really enjoy Macaulay Culkin's role as Kevin in the movie.
So have you watch the Pirates of The Carribean?
I couldn't even spell his name lol
What does he doe?
I have not watched Pirates of the Caribbean, but I can tell you that in Home Alone, Kevin is mistakenly left behind when his family flies to Paris for their Christmas vacation.
How do you mistakenly leave him behind. Just call his cell phone
He enjoys being home alone, but unfortunately he has to contend with two burglars played by Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern.
Haha! I don't think cell phones existed quite the same way in 1990, when Home Alone was released.
Oh
Well, why didn't they just take him? Seems more like neglect
Parents should go to jail and he be put in a foster home.
There was a lot of confusion going on as there was a power outage during the night. The whole family was rushing to get everything together and in the confusion managed to leave the poor kid behind.
Seems like his parents don't care about him that much.

I agree, it was very irresponsible of the parents
. But at the same time, Kevin did enjoy being home alone!
How old was Kevin?
Kevin was only 8 years old in the movie. Definitely too young to be left alone!
The parents did notice that Kevin was missing as soon as they arrived in Paris at least.
Yea, well eight year olds also think that smoking is enjoyable
Can't trust their feelings
Well either way, once you look past the implausible plot, I'm sure you'll enjoy the slapstick humor the movie offers.
I don't think I want my kids watching that movie.
Have you seen Batman?
It may be a little violent for kids, I agree. In the film, Kevin sets up a lot of elaborate booby-traps in dealing with the burglars.
Yes, I have.
What doesn't he just call the police?
Actually, Kevin does call the police, and they eventually end up arresting the burglars Harry and Marv.
Wait. what?
Yeah, I guess it just took them awhile. It's pretty ridiculous!
It's okay
The police don't even arrive until a man named Marley knocks the burglars out with a shovel. Crazy!
I think I like watching movies that I consider fantasy to be more fun for me
The police are slow, that's unfortunate
But if I am driving with tinted windows, boy are they ready!
Hi I think we have been chatting for a while. I have to go now though. It was fun talking to you!
Indeed they are! Ha! At least everything turns out okay for Kevin in the end, as he's reunited with his family after they manage to get a direct flight back to Chicago where they live.

uid1response.feedback: It was a little tricky to respond to the other user with the document, as they had some moral issues with the film it seemed. They also randomly talked about Batman, Pirates of the Caribbean, and other unrelated fantasy movies.

uid2response.feedback: !niaga sdrawkcab gnipyt si siht dna tolp eht wonk ot detnaw tsuj I
